TypeSignature.Value: public interface IUserTwoFactorTokenProvider<TUser> where TUser : class
.class public interface auto ansi abstract IUserTwoFactorTokenProvider`1<class TUser>

Docs.summary: Provides an abstraction for two factor token generators.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<bool> CanGenerateTwoFactorTokenAsync (Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.UserManager<TUser> manager, TUser user);

Docs.param: The that can be used to retrieve user properties.
The user a token could be generated for.
Docs.summary: Returns a flag indicating whether the token provider can generate a token suitable for two factor authentication token for the specified .
Docs.returns: The that represents the asynchronous operation, containing the a flag indicating if a two factor token could be generated by this provider for the specified . The task will return true if a two factor authentication token could be generated, otherwise false.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<string> GenerateAsync (string purpose, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.UserManager<TUser> manager, TUser user);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<string> GenerateAsync(string purpose, class Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.UserManager`1<!TUser> manager, !TUser user) cil managed

Docs.param: The purpose the token will be used for.
The that can be used to retrieve user properties.
The user a token should be generated for.
Docs.summary: Generates a token for the specified and .
Docs.returns: The that represents the asynchronous operation, containing the token for the specified and .
Docs.remarks:
The parameter allows a token generator to be used for multiple types of token whilst insuring a token for one purpose cannot be used for another. For example if you specified a purpose of "Email" and validated it with the same purpose a token with the purpose of TOTP would not pass the heck even if it was for the same user.
Implementations of should validate that purpose is not null or empty to help with token separation.
